sentence.Network_en: Despite his unconventional methods, he has inspired pupils more than anyone else.
sentence.Network_cn: 尽管他的方法不同寻常，但他给予学生的激励比其他人都要多。

sentence.Network_en: He had rather unconventional work habits, preferring to work through the night.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的工作习惯跟一般人很不一样，喜欢通宵工作。

sentence.Network_en: Zita was herself unconventional, keeping a safety-pin stuck through her ear lobe.
sentence.Network_cn: 齐塔自己就不守传统，在一只耳垂上穿了一根别针。

entry.tran: （人、态度、行为）不遵循传统的，异于常人的，标新立异的
entry.def: If you describe a person or their attitude or behaviour as unconventional, you mean that they do not behave in the same way as most other people in their society.

example.ex: Linus Pauling is an unconventional genius...
example.tran: 莱纳斯·鲍林是个标新立异的天才人物。

example.ex: He was known for his unconventional behaviour...
example.tran: 他的特立独行是众所周知的。

entry.tran: （做事方式）非传统的，不寻常的，非一般的
entry.def: An unconventional way of doing something is not the usual way of doing it, and may be rather surprising.

example.ex: The vaccine had been produced by an unconventional technique...
example.tran: 该疫苗是用非传统工艺生产的。

example.ex: Despite his unconventional methods, he has inspired pupils more than anyone else...
example.tran: 尽管他的方法不同寻常，但他给予学生的激励比其他人都要多。

means.word_mean: 1. not conforming to accepted rules or standards;
3. not conforming to legality, moral law, or social convention;
